xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description:
This modules provides a set of functions to modify a collection and retrieve the items contained in a particular collection.
This module is part of Zorba's XQuery Data Definition Facility. All the collections managed by this module have to be pre-declared in the prolog of a module. Please refer to the general documentation for more information and examples.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: Nicolae Brinza, Matthias Brantner, David Graf, Till Westmann, Markos Zaharioudakis

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the sequence of nodes or JSON items from a collection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $name The name of the collection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The seqnence of items from the collection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: zerr:ZDDY0001 if the collection is not declared.
zerr:ZDDY0003 if the collection is not available.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function cdml:collection($name as xs:QName) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the sequence of nodes or JSON items from a collection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $name The name of the collection.
$skip The initial number of items to skip.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The (sub)sequence of items from the collection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: zerr:ZDDY0001 if the collection is not declared.
zerr:ZDDY0003 if the collection is not available.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: cdml:collection
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function cdml:collection($name as xs:QName, $skip as xs:integer) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Gets the sequence of items (nodes or JSON items) from a collection. The parameters $start and $skip can be used to skip over some items at the beginning of the collection. If both are given, both are applied: first $start to skip to the referenced item and then $skip to skip that additional number of items.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $name The name of the collection.
$start The reference to the first item to return.
$skip The number of additional items to skip.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The sub-sequence from the collection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: zerr:ZAPI0028 If the given URI is not a valid node position computed by the np:node-position function.
zerr:ZDDY0001 if the collection is not declared.
zerr:ZDDY0003 if the collection is not available.
zerr:ZSTR0066 if $start does not reference a node from the collection.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: cdml:collection
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function cdml:collection($name as xs:QName, $start as xs:anyURI, $skip as xs:integer) as item()* external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Inserts copies of the given items (nodes or JSON items) into a collection. Note that the insertion position of the items in the collection is not defined.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $name The name of the collection to insert into.
$content The sequence of items whose copies to insert.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: An empty XDM instance and a pending update list that, once applied, inserts the items into the collection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: zerr:ZDDY0001 if the collection is not declared.
zerr:ZDDY0003 if the collection is not available.
zerr:ZDDY0006 if the collection is append-only, const, or queue.
zerr:ZDTY0001 if $content does not match the expected type as specified in the collection declaration according to the rules for SequenceType Matching.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: cdml:insert
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare updating function cdml:insert($name as xs:QName, $content as item()*) external

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: The insert-after function is an updating function that inserts copies of the given items (nodes or JSON items) into a collection at the position directly following the given target item.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $name The name of the collection to insert into.
$target The item in the collection after which $content will be inserted.
$content The sequence of items whose copies to insert.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: An empty XDM instance and a pending update list that, once applied, inserts the items into the collection.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: zerr:ZDDY0001 if the collection is not declared.
zerr:ZDDY0003 if the collection is not available.
zerr:ZDDY0006 if the collection is const, append-only, or queue.
zerr:ZDDY0012 if the collection is unordered.
zerr:ZDTY0001 if $content does not match the expected type as specified in the collection declaration according to the rules for SequenceType Matching.
zerr:ZDDY0011 if $target is not a node that is contained in the collection.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Deletes items (nodes or JSON items) from a collection.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Edits the first supplied item so as to make it look exactly like a copy of the second supplied item while retaining its original identity.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $target The target item to be edited.
$content The item that serves as an edit goal.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: An empty XDM instance and a pending update list that, once applied, performs the edit.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: zerr:ZDDY0001 if the collection to which $target belongs is not declared.
zerr:ZDDY0003 if the collection to which $target belongs is not available.
zerr:ZDDY0006 if the collection to which $target belongs is append-only, const, or queue.
zerr:ZDDY0017 if $target is not a member of a collection.
zerr:ZDDY0037 if the collection is append-only.
zerr:ZDDY0038 if the collection is a queue.
zerr:ZDDY0039 if $target is not a root.
zerr:ZDDY0040 if $target cannot be updated to match the content (for example, because the target is a node and the content is an object).
zerr:ZDTY0001 if $content does not match the expected type (as specified in the collection declaration) according to the rules for SequenceType Matching.

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Deletes the entire contents of collection. Please note that applying this function can not be undone in case an error happens during the application of the containing PUL.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $name The name of the collection whose content to delete.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: An empty XDM instance and a pending update list that, once applied, deletes the nodes.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: zerr:ZDDY0001 if the collection is not declared.
zerr:ZDDY0003 if the collection is not available.
